results.title: The Day begins
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Keystone Film Company
results.brief_description: Unable to play his part, Charlie is thrown out of the movie studio. In his efforts to return he disguises himself as a woman, causing havoc for the film crew and landing him in deep water ending with a chase through the Keystone sets. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Roscoe (Fatty) Arbuckle, Charles Murray.
results.description: Unable to play his part, Charlie is thrown out of the movie studio. results.title: A Day at the dump
results.brief_description: A case history examining the folly of haphazard waste disposal. For 25 years, a quarter of a million tons of municipal refuse a year went up in smoke at a Washington dump. Depicts the conditions before funds for a comprehensive waste disposal program were made available. (The solution is presented in “Burn, bury or what?”)

results.title: Day and night
results.creator_credit: Margaret Simpson, Franz Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An explanation of the occurrence of day and night by means of experiments with a rotating model globe. The film deals with the rotation of the earth on its tilted axis; the sun as a source of light to the earth; the cause of day and night; the movement of the earth, with its tilted axis, round the sun, and the effect of this tilting on the length of day and night in the four seasons of the year.

results.title: Day after day
results.creator_credit: Clement Perron, Fernand Dansereau, Hubert Aquin, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A look at life in a small paper-milling town in Quebec where most of the 6,500 inhabitants derive their livelihood from the one industry. Day after day the same work, the same hours, the same machines, the same product, until the entire routine of living becomes but a reflection of the dominant routines of the mill. The commentary is made up largely of fragments of thoughts which might be running through the minds of the mill workers - this is the film’s theme as it probes to the very core of company-town life. (Awards: Toronto, San Francisco, Montreal, Chicago, New York)

results.title: The Dawn of industry
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions, Gerard Bryant and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The history of the hovercraft’s development including an interview with its inventor, Christopher Cockerell. Various uses, both commercial and military, are shown, and some of its posible future applications are described.

results.title: Profile of a problem drinker
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The causes of drinking and the effects of liquor on the life of a young architect, analysing some of the reasons which may lead to a person to problem drinking. Shows the importance of recognising the early symptoms of alcoholism and dramatises the remedial action necessary for effective cure..

results.title: David Livingston
results.creator_credit: David Middlemas, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank
results.brief_description: Outlines the early days of David Livingston(e) in Africa and the series of journeys throughout the continent extending over a period of 30 years. The film illustrates particularly the importance of Livington’s exploration and actual scenes show the nature of the country through which he made his journeys. Tribute is paid to his work in combating the slave trade. The film ends with a reconstruction of this meeting with Stanley and an artist’s impression of his death and the final journey of his body to the coast and to Westminster Abbey.

results.title: David Coleman: cabinet maker
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb, John Read and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Craftsman”.
David Coleman and his assistants make beautiful reproduction antique furniture in a workshop in the little village of Stebbing, Essex, almost all of which is exported to the U.S.A

group_siblings.title: Notes on a harpsichord
group_siblings.creator_credit: David Cheshire, John Read and BBC-TV

results.title: David and Mr Micawber (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David copperfield”. Features Robert Morley as Mr Micawber, one of Dickens’ most memorable characters. Tells of young David’s arrival in London, and his befriending by the Micawbers. Mr Micawber is subsequently imprisoned for debt, is released and departs for Plymouth where with characteristic optimism he is sure “something will turn up”.
